text: Roofing membrane type (TPO, SBS, EPDM, etc.) as per approved submittal
Insulation type, R-value, and overlay board per drawing and CAN/ULC-S704 standard
Adhesives, sealants, cleaners, fasteners, and flashings per manufacturer recommendation
All materials protected from UV, rain, and stored dry on pallets/sleepers
Pre-installation meeting conducted with roofing sub, consultant, and owner
Wind uplift calculations performed using NRC Wind-RCI tool and approved design submitted
All penetrations, vent stacks, drains, parapets prepared before install
Substrate dry, clean, firm, and approved by consultant
Vapor retarder membrane installed continuous with sealed laps and terminations
Nailers installed per detail and fastened with 300 kg/m resistance capacity
Insulation boards staggered and tight, no gaps; damaged boards replaced
Overlay board installed using full bead adhesive per manufacturer’s spacing and coverage
TPO/EPDM/SBS membrane installed straight with minimum overlap (typically 75–150 mm)
Membrane fastened per uplift specs; no overdriven fasteners
Field seams welded by trained operator using automatic hot-air welder; hand welds only for repairs
Exposed membrane cleaned with TPO Weathered Cleaner if >7 days old before welding
Base and curb flashings installed continuous, reinforced per spec
Drain pans, pipe boots, stack covers installed and welded/sealed correctly
Edge metal, termination bars, and sealants installed and approved
QA/QC and third-party inspection conducted prior to warranty request
Walkway protection boards installed around rooftop units
Roofing warranty issued (10-year minimum full system) covering membrane and workmanship
